July 16, 1928.
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I beg to thank you for your note of the
15th of July. It is indeed a pleasure to learn
that the work is going along so well.

I am in no hurry about the estimate of time
necessary to complete the work so long as you bear it
in mind and send it as soon as it is feasible. I
know that this is the summer season. The days are
terribly hot and one neither can nor should attempt
to work as hard as during better weather. I hope
to go to Washington some time in September and shall
then most certainly look you up.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss Laura Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street NW
Washington D. C.
